sentence.text: Patient 3 (Fig. 2C) is a 29-year-old man affected with right unilateral cleft lip and palate with dysmorphic facial features similar to his brother.
He was born with a myelomeningocele and diagnosed with spastic quadriparesis.
He has blepharophimosis, high arched eyebrows, hypertelorism, long curly eyelashes, mildly upslanted palpebral fissures, ptosis, and a bowed upper lip.
He has significant kyphosis, scoliosis, short downslanting shoulders, abnormal scapulae, and hyperextensible joints of the hands.
He has profound sensorineural hearing loss in the left ear and mild conductive hearing loss in the right ear.
At 7 years old, he was treated for a desmoid tumor and received bilateral psoas resections, bilateral medial hamstring lengthening, and bilateral adductor tenotomy.
He had a glandular hypospaidias and bilateral orchidopexy at 8 years old.
He has average cognitive functioning and finished college.
He has subluxation of the left hip and spastic contractures of both lower extremities that has left him wheelchair bound.
